00026 #ifndef ais_resources_h
00027 #define ais_resources_h
00028 
00029 #include <string>
00030 #include <vector>
00031 #include <map>
00032 
00033 #include "Regex.h"
00034 
00035 #ifndef resource_h
00036 #include "Resource.h"
00037 #endif
00038 
00039 #ifndef ais_exceptions_h
00040 #include "AISExceptions.h"
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 using std::string;
00044 using std::vector;
00045 using std::map;
00046 using std::pair;
00047 using std::binary_function;
00048 
00049 typedef vector<Resource> ResourceVector;
00050 typedef ResourceVector::iterator ResourceVectorIter;
00051 typedef ResourceVector::const_iterator ResourceVectorCIter;
00052 
00064 class AISResources {
00065 private:
00066     typedef map<string, ResourceVector> ResourceMap;
00067     typedef ResourceMap::iterator ResourceMapIter;
00068     typedef ResourceMap::const_iterator ResourceMapCIter;
00069     
00070     typedef pair<string, ResourceVector> RVPair;
00071     typedef vector<RVPair> ResourceRegexps;
00072     typedef ResourceRegexps::iterator ResourceRegexpsIter;
00073     typedef ResourceRegexps::const_iterator ResourceRegexpsCIter;
00074 
00075     ResourceMap d_db;       // This holds the URL resources
00076     ResourceRegexps d_re;   // This holds the regular expression res.
00077 
00078     // Scan RegExps looking for a particular regular expression.
00079     struct FindRegexp : public binary_function<RVPair, string, bool> {
00080     string local_re;
00081     FindRegexp(const string &re) : local_re(re) {}
00082     bool operator()(const RVPair &p) { return p.first == local_re; }
00083     };
00084 
00085     // Scan RegExps looking for one that matches a URL.
00086     // *** Make this more efficient by storing the Regex objects in the
00087     // vector. 03/11/03 jhrg
00088     struct MatchRegexp : public binary_function<RVPair, string, bool> {
00089     string candidate;
00090     MatchRegexp(const string &url) : candidate(url) {}
00091     bool operator()(const RVPair &p) { 
00092         Regex r(p.first.c_str());
00093         return r.match(candidate.c_str(), candidate.length()) != -1;
00094     }
00095     };
00096 
00097     friend class AISResourcesTest; // unit tests access to private stuff
00098     friend ostream &operator<<(ostream &os, const AISResources &ais_res);
00099 
00100 public:
00102     AISResources() {}
00103     AISResources(const string &database) throw(AISDatabaseReadFailed);
00104 
00105     virtual ~AISResources() {}
00106 
00107     virtual void add_url_resource(const string &url, 
00108                   const Resource &ancillary);
00109     virtual void add_url_resource(const string &url, const ResourceVector &rv);
00110 
00111     virtual void add_regexp_resource(const string &regexp, 
00112                      const Resource &ancillary);
00113     virtual void add_regexp_resource(const string &regexp,
00114                      const ResourceVector &rv);
00115 
00116     virtual bool has_resource(const string &primary) const;
00117 
00118     virtual ResourceVector get_resource(const string &primary)
00119     throw(NoSuchPrimaryResource);
00120 
00121     virtual void read_database(const string &database) 
00122     throw(AISDatabaseReadFailed);
00123     
00124     virtual void write_database(const string &filename) 
00125     throw(AISDatabaseWriteFailed);
00126 };

00134 // it is now possible to list a regular expression in place of an explicit
00135 // URL. The AIS will try to match this Regexp against candidate URLs and
00136 // return the ancillary resources for all those that succeed.
